metadata.synopsis: A woman tries ESP to find her husband (Bradford Dillman), imprisoned in a madwoman's (Shelley Winters) basement.

reviews: Joan Collins and James Booth are unconvincing even on this low level; and the best talent, Sinead Cusack, is thrown away in a minor part.
The film makes the mistake of wanting to he a bit of everything: tense, shocking, funny, old-fashioned, and morally correct.
A thoroughly nasty bit of work.
[Revenge is] done with deadly solemnity and a truly atrocious script.
